conclusion: The problem involves analyzing the motion of a rod with two balls attached at its ends, rotating around a point O, with the goal of determining the force exerted by ball B on the rod when ball A is at its highest point.
The rod has a length of 3L, with ball A at one end and ball B at the other. Point O is located at a distance L from ball A and 2L from ball B. The system rotates in a vertical plane around point O.
The force exerted by ball A on the rod is the centripetal force, given by \( F_A = m \cdot v^2/L \), where \( v \) is the velocity of ball A at the highest point.
At the highest point of ball A, the velocity \( v \) is zero. Therefore, the force exerted by ball A is \( F_A = 0 \).
Since ball A exerts no force on the rod, the force exerted by ball B on the rod must be equal to the centripetal force exerted by ball A.
The centripetal force exerted by ball A is \( F_A = m \cdot v^2/L \). Since \( F_A = 0 \), the force exerted by ball B must also be \( 0 \).
Since the force exerted by ball B on the rod is zero, there is no net force acting on the system.
Conclude that the force exerted by ball B on the rod is zero.
